Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have things been since our last conversation?
Hi! Things have been pretty good, actually. I shared an idea in a meeting!
That’s fantastic! How did it go?
It went really well! People seemed interested, and I felt good about speaking up.
That’s a huge accomplishment! How did you feel before and after sharing your idea?
I was really nervous before, but after, I felt relieved and proud of myself.
That’s wonderful to hear! It sounds like you’re building your confidence. Have you noticed any changes in how you approach meetings since then?
Yeah, I’m trying to prepare a bit more and remind myself that my ideas are valid.
That’s a great strategy! Preparation can help alleviate anxiety. Have you had any other opportunities to share your thoughts?
I actually spoke up again in another meeting! It’s becoming a little easier.
That’s excellent progress! It’s great to see you taking those steps. How about your relationship with your sister? Have you had any more discussions since we last spoke?
Yes, we talked again about our disagreements, and I tried to keep the conversation calm. It went well!
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re developing healthier communication patterns. How did that make you feel?
I felt closer to her, which was nice. It’s good to talk things out rather than argue.
That’s a significant shift! Building strong relationships is so important. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I’d like to explore my feelings about being more outgoing. Sometimes I still feel hesitant.
Absolutely, let’s dive into that. What situations make you feel most hesitant to be outgoing?
When I’m in larger groups or meeting new people, I tend to hold back.
That’s understandable. What do you think contributes to that hesitation?
I think I worry about being judged or not fitting in.
Those feelings are common. Have you considered any strategies to help you feel more comfortable in those situations?
Maybe I could set a small goal, like introducing myself to one new person at a gathering.
That sounds like a great plan! Setting small, achievable goals can help ease the pressure. How do you feel about trying that?
I think I can do that! It feels less intimidating when it’s just one person.
Exactly! And remember, it’s about making connections, not about impressing others. How do you think you would feel after trying that?
I think I’d feel proud of myself, even if it’s just a small step.
That’s the spirit! Celebrate those small victories. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that’s it for now. I feel good about what we talked about.
I’m glad to hear that! You’re making great progress. I look forward to hearing about your experiences in our next session.
Thanks! I’m looking forward to it too.
Take care, and see you soon!
Bye!
